wikipedia_page.main: Mark Andrew Coombe (born 17 September 1968) is a former professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper for Football League clubs Colchester United and Torquay United, amongst many non-league teams.

response: He moved on to recently relegated Newport County, but as Newport folded and failed to complete their Conference season, he returned to Torquay for a third time in April 1989 to cover for the injured Ken Veysey and played at Wembley in the Associate Members' Cup Final as Torquay's only other professional keeper Mark Coombe was cup-tied. He retired from football in June 1989 to work for the Post Office.
